text:
This new task looks inside a nested <path/> for occurrences of a file and 
stores all locations as a property. See the included manual for details.
creator: hl45@dl.ac.uk

text:
For the meanwhile have a look at the tutorial "Tasks using Properties, Filesets 
& Paths" [1]: 
  "The goal is to write a task, which searchs in a path for a file 
  and saves the location of that file in a property."

[1] http://ant.apache.org/manual/tutorial-tasks-filesets-properties.html
creator: jan@materne.de
mbenson@apache.org
text:
FYI The available task can also search for files in a path.  However, it a)
returns as soon as it finds a single match, and b) sets a property to a
predetermined value, rather than the location of the found file.

This can be done with ResourceCollections, in CVS HEAD for Ant 1.7 .

The path can be expressed in terms of filesets.

<path id="p">
  <fileset dir="lookhere" />
  <fileset dir="lookthere" />
  <fileset dir="lookelsewhere" />
</path>

You can limit the files matched with the restrict collection:

<restrict id="r">
  <path refid="p" />
  <choose-a-resource-selector />
</restrict>

If you need to put this in a property, use pathconvert:

<pathconvert refid="r" property="r" />

Voila!
creator: mbenson@apache.org
